actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, March 27, 2025,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, March 27, 2025, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 153 (Sen. Ernst):
        A resolution designating March 27, 2025, as "National Women in Agriculture Day".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN12-11:
        Harmeet Dhillon, of California, to be an AssistantAttorney General

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN12-39:
        Dean Sauer, of Missouri, to be Solicitor General of the United States

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 4/2/2025.


 PN25-56:
        Matthew Whitaker, of Iowa, to be United States Permanent Representative on the Council of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, with the rank and status of Ambassador

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 42. Record Vote Number: 156 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 157

PN12-34:
        Mehmet Oz, of Pennsylvania, to be Administrator ofthe Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN25-56:
        Matthew Whitaker, of Iowa, to be United States Permanent Representative on the Council of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, with the rank and status of Ambassador

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 42. Record Vote Number: 156 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 157
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Thune, at  9:19 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. on Wednesday, April 2, 2025.
